original_title: Sri Lanka Treasuries yields rise across maturities
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields rose across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with only 124.8 billion of the offered bills being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 64.3 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.66 percent, up 19 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 80 billion rupees.
24.8 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.30 percent, up 8 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion rupees.
35.6 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.97 percent, up 18 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion. (Colombo/ May24/2023)
